org.fishwife.jrugged

Interface ServiceWrapper

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CircuitBreaker, ConstantFlowRegulator, LatencyTracker, PerformanceMonitor, RequestCounter, ServiceRetrier, ServiceWrapperChain

    public interface ServiceWrapper
    Several of the "rugged" code patterns in this library can be used to wrap an existing service in a "decorator" design pattern. This is the common interface provided by these wrapping classes that affect normal service calls.

    If you are more into aspect-oriented programming (AOP), then you can also use the ServiceWrapper classes in your aspects.

      throws Exception
        Wraps a Callable in some fashion.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The callable type I am wrapping
        Parameters:
        c - the service call to wrap
        Returns:
        whatever c would normally return
        Throws:
        Exception - if c throws one

             T result)
      throws Exception
        Wraps a Runnable task in some fashion, and returns a predetermined result on success.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The return TYPE that should emit
        Parameters:
        r - the service call/task to wrap
        result - what to return on success
        Returns:
        result
        Throws:
